content.question: In which of the following examples is the beaming correct throughout?

choices.label: Two measures of music in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter note, eighth note and two sixteenths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, and a quarter note.

Two measures of music in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter note, eighth note and two sixteenths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, three eighths beamed together, an eighth note, and a quarter note.

Two measures of music in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter note, eighth note, two sixteenths and two eighths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, two eighths beamed together, and a quarter note.
Two measures of music in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter note, eighth note, two sixteenths and two eighths beamed together, three eighths beamed together, an eighth note, and a quarter note.

content.answer: Two measures of music in six-eight. The rhythms are quarter note, eighth note, two sixteenths and two eighths beamed together, three eighths beamed together, an eighth note, and a quarter note.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in notated music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
